body:
Hello everyone,
So I disappear for two days and things get chaotic. I would like formally apologise in behalf of the Administrative team, senior moderator team and the moderator team for the amount of misunderstanding on the Forums lately. 

No rule of fake hacking will be implemented, but depending on the intention of course. None of the moderators should have responded to that matter since they have no official say in what is implemented. Therefore I would like to apologise to anyone who has been falsely banned and kept mature about it. 
However I don't understand why there is so much hate/disrespect towards the staff when all we are doing is trying to do our job. Sure, we all make mistakes but you know, we can't fix it if you are being immature about it. Cooperate with us instead, please.
That aside, I had many plans. I want to remove the ability for mods to lock public posts and keep it for senior moderators and above... staff training, making sure staff don't ban someone off first impression etc.

I hope you stop doubting the staff, and stop disrespecting us since it's voluntry work.
Coming back from a short holiday to this definetly pissed me off! haha

Edit: it's sad that I have to apologise about this because it should never have happened.
body_tagged:
Hello everyone,
So I disappear for two days and things get chaotic. I would like formally apologise in behalf of the Administrative team, senior moderator team and the moderator team for the amount of misunderstanding on the Forums lately. 

No rule of fake hacking will be implemented, but depending on the intention of course. None of the moderators should have responded to that matter since they have no official say in what is implemented. Therefore I would like to apologise to anyone who has been falsely banned and kept mature about it. 
However I don't understand why there is so much hate/disrespect towards the staff when all we are doing is trying to do our job. Sure, we all make mistakes but you know, we can't fix it if you are being immature about it. Cooperate with us instead, please.
That aside, I had many plans. I want to remove the ability for mods to lock public posts and keep it for senior moderators and above... staff training, making sure staff don't ban someone off first impression etc.

I hope you stop doubting the staff, and stop disrespecting us since it's voluntry work.
Coming back from a short holiday to this definetly pissed me off! haha

Edit: it's sad that I have to apologise about this because it should never have happened.
title: Quick message o/

replies.body:
I didn't participated in this whole conversation/argument because I didn't really understood why everyone is biching out about the rule. I understand the waterfall rule and I would be glad if that would be implemented. It really makes the servers lagging if you build a 100 block long skybridge and then you put 100 water source blocks on the whole length, and 150 blocks above the ground. I would say that's no longer a tactic. Sure you can use 1 water source from that height to go down, that doesn't matter, but if there are more than 10 water sources and the water falls down, then it's creating lag.
I dont thinkYOU should apologise for that. It would be better if the staff members that were involved in the falme wars are going to apologise.
And maybe staff members have to record hackers before they ban them to have evidence if the player says he got falsely banned.

replies.body:
Thank you for not implementing the rule and apologizing to all. And not to be a whiner, but the staff team still hasn't admitted that there's a hell of a lot of false bans and that the standards do need to be upped. That's my issue, it feels like the staff never assume responsibility, and it gets rather annoying. I have not heard one staff member say anything along the lines of "Yeah there's a lot of false bans, we should fix that". I only hear "We're only human" over and over as if to cover yourselves. 

The first step to getting better is admitting there's a problem. 

Not that I don't appreciate the staff team, but It's annoying when no-one admits there are a lot of false bans, takes ownership, and has the guts to say they screwed up. 

All the staff are really nice and friendly, which is amazing (this is less common than you'd think). The staff team just needs work on hack detection and admitting their mistakes.

replies.body:
I see your point, and it's completely valid. But, you need to understand that the staff team is doing a lot behind the scenes.We are currently in a period where things need to be fixed/sorted and will be fixed/sorted.

On behalf of the Moderating team, I would like to honestly apologize for the false bans. We are trying to improve everyday, we are also working on a new system that will help us, or in other words be more accurate when dealing with rule breakers.

If you have any concerns that you believe that should be addressed, feel free to contact the Sr Staff in a polite manner. We need the communities help to make Avicus a friendly and enjoyable environment.

Thank you for your time, and have a great day/night!

replies.body:
That's not an excuse, if you're a moderator in any server you should have at least a little idea of what hacks look like, you can't base a ban on how a person twitches his head. And if you do have a mentoring system coming soon, make sure it does come soon because they said there would be a Winter Update but this will turn into a Spring update more likely.

On Topic: Thanks for the post Jozz, you're a god.

replies.body:
Both parties were pretty pathetic on this one.
The amount of arguing and attacking from the community was extremely disappointing.

Yes, this whole ordel was confusing to say the least, I'm sorry players were mislead and can understand the confusion.

But the way some of you acted was extremely
lacklustre. 

Staff aren't machines, we're people too. 
Like it or not, just like you, we make mistakes. It's a fact of life, people make mistakes.
I don't like how because we're staff, some people say that "isn't a good reason" when it is.

I'm not saying there aren't things we need to work on, because there are but work with us, not against us. 

We're not here to be your enemy.
The staff team are here to help. We voluntarily take time out of our lives to make this place better. If we wanted to, we could all stop moderating tomorrow.

But we don't want to do that. Why? Because we want to see this server succeed and so do you.

So lets help each other out here.

But we don't want to do that. Why? Because we want to see this server succeed and so do you.

So lets help each other out here.

replies.body:
Yeah people make mistakes, I make mistakes too.

The difference is that I can accept I made a mistake and don't have to make up some fake rule like a four year old to cover my pride.

The reason a lot of people are annoyed about this isn't that it's a bad rule (even though it was), it's the fact that the staff who were easily in the wrong didn't apologise or admit they were in the wrong.

But we don't want to do that. Why? Because we want to see this server succeed and so do you.

So lets help each other out here.

If you're not a machine maybe getting a GCheat plugin or code one would be good so the bans are accurate and the community doesn't complain again :)

reply_to.body:
Both parties were pretty pathetic on this one.
The amount of arguing and attacking from the community was extremely disappointing.

Yes, this whole ordel was confusing to say the least, I'm sorry players were mislead and can understand the confusion.

But the way some of you acted was extremely
lacklustre. 

Staff aren't machines, we're people too. 
Like it or not, just like you, we make mistakes. It's a fact of life, people make mistakes.
I don't like how because we're staff, some people say that "isn't a good reason" when it is.

I'm not saying there aren't things we need to work on, because there are but work with us, not against us. 

We're not here to be your enemy.
The staff team are here to help. We voluntarily take time out of our lives to make this place better. If we wanted to, we could all stop moderating tomorrow.

But we don't want to do that. Why? Because we want to see this server succeed and so do you.

So lets help each other out here.

replies.body:
@Juano Those plugins aren't perfectly accurate. The best we'll get is moderators who are above par at identifying hacks (Which sadly, is hard to come by on all servers)

@Snow You actually bring up a lot of good points that people tend to miss. However..

@Shadow Brings up an excellent point. I'm also guilty of it. Many of us try to twist the facts around to make something seem perfectly valid. This "rule" is a prime example of this. The moderators twisted facts to make the rule seem like an acceptable addition, when the truth is, it wasn't good at all. Along with the fact that many people believe staff to be above regular players, those people would start supporting the mods regardless of whether or not it was a good addition or not, which would put the staff in a higher position, giving an even bigger opportunity to cover our pride as best as we can.

For staff, it's much easier to cover our mistakes, but it's also very difficult in other cases. We are only human, though. However, we shouldn't have gone that far, that mistake was way too big. Little ones are fine, I make a little one at least once a day, but something like that needs a LOT of consideration from SEVERAL moderators, experienced and not-so-experienced. Aka, you should've gotten the opinions from somebody who's been here for a while. I even would've been fine to talk to.
replies.body_tagged:

The moderators twisted facts to make the rule seem like an acceptable addition, when the truth is, it wasn't good at all. Along with the fact that many people believe staff to be above regular players, those people would start supporting the mods regardless of whether or not it was a good addition or not, which would put the staff in a higher position, giving an even bigger opportunity to cover our pride as best as we can.

For staff, it's much easier to cover our mistakes, but it's also very difficult in other cases. We are only human, though. However, we shouldn't have gone that far, that mistake was way too big. Little ones are fine, I make a little one at least once a day, but something like that needs a LOT of consideration from SEVERAL moderators, experienced and not-so-experienced. Aka, you should've gotten the opinions from somebody who's been here for a while. I even would've been fine to talk to.

replies.body:
Badlion's is not perfect but it's really accurate.
Trust me, there was a judgement day were all the famous players that cheated and were caugh by this GCheat were banned.
Weeks later, each of the ones banned made a video where they said they autoclicked/hacked.
I would give a 85% of accurancy and so far, there have been like 2 or 3 false bans.
